intro: Polygonum calcatum, commonly known as the black nightshade or Indian tobacco, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It features upright stems that are often hairy and can grow up to 1 meter in height. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, blooming from late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly rough texture. Polygonum calcatum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
